verses.verse: I said, <S%H559><s%> "I will watch <S%H8104><s%> my ways, <S%H1870><s%> so that I don't <S%H2398><s%> sin with my tongue. <S%H3956><s%> I will keep <S%H8104><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%> with a bridle <S%H4269><s%> while the wicked is before me. <S%H7563><s%>"
I was mute <S%H481><s%> with silence. <S%H1747><s%> I held my peace, <S%H2814><s%> even from good. <S%H2896><s%> My sorrow <S%H3511><s%> was stirred. <S%H5916><s%>

My heart <S%H3820><s%> was hot <S%H2552><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me. <S%H1901><s%> While I meditated, the fire <S%H784><s%> burned: <S%H1197><s%> <S%H227><s%> I spoke <S%H1696><s%> with my tongue: <S%H3956><s%>
"Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> show <S%H3045><s%> me my end, <S%H7093><s%> what is the measure <S%H4060><s%> of my days. <S%H3117><s%> Let me know <S%H3045><s%> how frail I am. <S%H2310><s%>

Behold, <S%H5414><s%> you have made my days <S%H3117><s%> handbreadths. <S%H2947><s%> My lifetime <S%H2465><s%> is as nothing before you. <S%H3605><s%> Surely every man <S%H120><s%> stands <S%H5324><s%> as <S%H3605><s%> a breath. <S%H1892><s%>" Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

"Surely every man <S%H376><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> like a shadow. <S%H6754><s%> Surely they busy <S%H1993><s%> themselves in vain. <S%H1892><s%> He heaps up, <S%H6651><s%> and doesn't <S%H3045><s%> know who shall gather. <S%H622><s%>
Now, <S%H136><s%> Lord, what do I wait <S%H6960><s%> for? <S%H8431><s%> My hope is in you.
Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from all my transgressions. <S%H6588><s%> Don't <S%H7760><s%> make me the reproach <S%H2781><s%> of the foolish. <S%H5036><s%>
I was mute. <S%H481><s%> I didn't <S%H6605><s%> open my mouth, <S%H6310><s%> because you did it. <S%H6213><s%>
Remove <S%H5493><s%> your scourge <S%H5061><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> from me. <S%H3615><s%> I am overcome by the blow <S%H8409><s%> of your hand. <S%H3027><s%>

When you rebuke <S%H8433><s%> and correct <S%H3256><s%> man <S%H376><s%> for iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> You consume <S%H4529><s%> his wealth <S%H2530><s%> like a moth. <S%H6211><s%> Surely every man <S%H120><s%> is but a breath. <S%H1892><s%>" Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

"Hear <S%H8085><s%> my prayer, <S%H8605><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and give ear <S%H238><s%> to my cry. <S%H7775><s%> Don't <S%H2790><s%> be silent at my tears. <S%H1832><s%> For I am a stranger <S%H1616><s%> with you, <S%H8453><s%> a foreigner, as all my fathers were. <S%H1><s%>
Oh spare <S%H8159><s%> me, <S%H1082><s%> that I may recover strength, before I go away, <S%H3212><s%> and exist no more."
